snippet: Some experts offered possible explanations for how the suspect could have strangled a boy and lived with the secret all these years; others wondered if he confessed to a crime he did not commit.
abstract: Mental health experts offer possible explanations, including mental illness, for how Pedro Hernandez, who has confessed to killing Etan Patz in 1979, could have strangled a boy and lived with the secret for three decades; others wonder if he confessed to a crime he did not commit.
lead_paragraph: Some experts offered possible explanations for how the suspect could have strangled a boy and lived with the secret all these years; others wondered if he confessed to a crime he did not commit.

headline.seo: Psychiatrists Weigh In on Hernandez and Patz Case Confession
headline.main: Psychiatrists Offer Theories About Suspect in Patz Case
headline.print_headline: Psychiatrists Offer Theories About Suspect In Patz Case
